alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 12:07PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river and creek in Nevada... Humboldt River Near Elko affecting Elko County. Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack which will maintain high stream and river flows. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Lamoille Creek...including Lamoille...elevated river levels are expected. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river flows caused by snowmelt are expected. * WHERE...Humboldt River Near Elko. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.2 feet, Minor Flood Stage - Minor lowland flooding occurs upstream and downstream of Elko. Very minor flooding from backed up storm drains begins in Elko, especially in the parking lots on Water Street between 7th and 9th Streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:40 AM PDT Monday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain around 6.0 feet through Tuesday. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.2 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
